content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. A random sample of <math alttext="25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> cans of soda was selected from a factory that produces soda. The amount of soda, in milliliters (<math alttext="m l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ml</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>), contained in each sampled can was measured. The data are shown in the following stem-and-leaf plot. (a) Describe the distribution of amount of soda in a can.

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. A random sample of <math alttext="25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> cans of soda was selected from a factory that produces soda. The amount of soda, in milliliters (<math alttext="m l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ml</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>), contained in each sampled can was measured. The data are shown in the following stem-and-leaf plot. (a) Describe the distribution of amount of soda in a can.

The factory uses two machines to fill the soda cans: Machine A and Machine B. The following back-to-back stem-and-leaf plot shows the soda amounts from the same random sample categorized by machine.(b) Calculate the median and <math alttext="I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>IQR</mtext></math> for each machine.Machine A median:Machine B median:Machine A <math alttext="I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>IQR</mtext></math>:Machine B <math alttext="I Q R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>IQR</mtext></math>:
(c) Compare the variability of the measurements in the amount of soda filled per can by the two machines by referencing the appropriate measure calculated in part (b). Justify your answer.

topic.text: 1.6: Describing the Distribution of a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe data presented numerically or graphically.
